item.title: The Time Series Forecasting Problem
item.description: Forecasting Problem A time series forecasting problem can be formulated as the following. Given a dataset $\mathcal D$, with $y^{(i)}_t$, the sequential variable to be forecasted, $x^{(i)}_t$, exogenous data for the time series data, $u^{(i)}_t$, some features that can be obtained or planned in advance, where ${}^{(i)}$ indicates the $i$th variable, ${}_ t$ denotes time. In a forecasting task, we use $y^{(i)} _ {t-K:t}$, $x^{(i) _ {t-K:t}}$, and $u^{(i)} _ {t-K:t+H}$, to forecast the future $y^{(i)} _ {t+1:t+H}$.
